author: bernama
title: Flood forecasted in ten districts in Kelantan from Dec 16 to 19
text:
KOTA BHARU: Ten out of 11 districts in Kelantan which have river basins are expected to experience flooding from Dec 16 to Dec 19.
The Department of Irrigation and Drainage (DID) issued this warning following a weather advisory by the Meteorological Department predicting continuous rainfall at the alert level.
The statement identified the affected districts as Tumpat, Pasir Mas, Kota Bharu, Tanah Merah, Bachok, Machang, Pasir Puteh, Kuala Krai, Jeli, and Gua Musang.
According to the DID, in Tumpat, the river basins include the Golok river basin (Sungai Pengkalan and Sungai Mentua), the Kelantan River Basin, and the Pengkalan Nangka River Basin.
In Pasir Mas, the river basins are the Kelantan river basin and Golok river basin, covering the Lemal Mati, Lemal, Rengas, Lacang, Tasik Danau To’ Uban, Tasek Garu, Lanchang, Bunut Susu, and Meranti rivers.
Meanwhile, in Kota Bharu, the Kelantan river basin will be affected, involving the Banggol Chicha, Gutong, Ketereh, Che Latif, Kemasin, Keseng, Melor, Mulong, Pengkalan Chepa, Pengkalan Datu, Raja Gali, Seribong, and Tikat rivers.
In the Tanah Merah district, the Golok river basin (Jegor and Lanas rivers) and Kelantan river basin (Jegor, Air Bujing, Kusial, Manal, and Jedok rivers) are expected to be affected.
In Bachok, the basins include the Gali river basin, Kemasin river basin (Jelawat River), and Semerak river basin (Lubuk Nibong and Melor rivers).
In the Machang district, the Kelantan river basin include the Abal, Bagan, Dalu, Galang, Hala, Hau, Joh, Kemudu, Kerak, Kerawang, Kweng Hitam, Maka, Panyit, Penasa, Penggam, Pertok, Pulai Condong, Rengas, Sat, Tanah Liat, Wek, and Sal rivers.
While in Pasir Puteh, the river basins in the district are the Kelantan river basin (Semerak and Tasek rivers) and the Semerak river basin (Belida, Besut, Daran Buaya, Jelor, Kelong, Tasek Pauh, Cherang Ruku, Bukit Abal, Buaya Ikat, Jeram, and Rasau rivers).
In the Kuala Krai district, the Kelantan river basin involve the Durian, Tagor, Galas, Sedulek, Geh, Nal, Lebir, Mel, Mesek, Pahi, Rek, Sam, Mas, Bedal, Geh, Kesang, Gatal, Lata Tunggil, Temalir, Pergau, Pertang, Salor, Sok, Cucuh Puteri, and Kerai rivers.
Jeli will experience the impact from the Golok river basin (Buloh, Lanas, Legeh, and Satan rivers), Pergau river basin (Chenedoh, Senolek, Kuak, Repang, and Buloh rivers), and Kelantan river basin (Pergau, Belahat, Jeli, Jentiang, and Taduh rivers).
Meanwhile, in Gua Musang, the Kelantan river basin include the Aring, Chalil, Chiku, Cindai, Galas, Keneras, Ketil, Lebir, Nenggiri, Paloh, and Tupai rivers.
The DID also cautioned that the predicted flood might occur earlier or later than anticipated.
According to the statement, the warning is issued to enable all residents, particularly those in flood-prone areas, to take precautionary measures and follow directives from authorities.

title: Care Right There Remains Committed to Offering Top-Tier Elderly Care in Glassboro, NJ | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
Care Right There in Glassboro, NJ, reaffirms its commitment to providing top-tier elderly care. Known for exceptional services, it offers personalized care plans ensuring seniors' independence and comfort at home. Trust and compassion are at the heart of their mission, making them a trusted leader in home care. Discover more about their dedicated services at https://carerightthere.com. Glassboro, NJ - Care Right There, a prominent provider of elderly care services, today announced its continued dedication to delivering unparalleled home care solutions to the seniors of Glassboro, NJ. Recognized for its exceptional services and as one of the leading home care agencies in Glassboro, NJ, Care Right There is reaffirming its commitment to the community, ensuring that residents have access to the high-quality care they deserve.
"Care Right There has always been at the forefront of providing superior elderly care in Glassboro, NJ. Our goal is to enhance the lives of our seniors, allowing them to maintain their independence and comfort in their homes. We understand the significance of trust and compassion in our care, and our team of professional caregivers is devoted to upholding these values daily," said Marisa A Betancourt, owner of Care Right There.
In response to the growing need for dependable elderly care in Glassboro, Care Right There offers a wide range of personalized services designed to meet the diverse needs of its clients. From daily living assistance to specialized care plans, the agency is dedicated to ensuring the well-being and satisfaction of the seniors it serves. This commitment underscores the importance of accessible, quality home care solutions that support families caring for their aging loved ones.
With the demand for elderly care services rising, Care Right There's steadfast dedication to meeting this demand reflects its deep-rooted commitment to the community of Glassboro, NJ. By continuously striving to provide top-notch care, Care Right There meets and exceeds the expectations of those it serves, solidifying its position as a trusted leader in the home care industry.
For more information about Care Right There and their elderly care in Glassboro, NJ , please visit their website at https://carerightthere.com
About Care Right There Home Care:
Care Right There is a leading provider of elderly care services in Glassboro, NJ. Known for its comprehensive care solutions and a team of dedicated caregivers, Care Right There prides itself on its ability to offer personalized, compassionate care that prioritizes the health and happiness of its clients. As one of the best home care agencies in Glassboro, NJ, Care Right There is committed to enhancing the lives of the elderly in the community, ensuring they receive the respect, dignity, and quality of care they deserve.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Eight RedHawks Recognized as Academic All-MAC
text:
Eight RedHawks Recognized as Academic All-MAC
Eight student-athletes from Miami University have been honored as Academic All-MAC for women's soccer, recognizing their excellence in both academics and athletics. To qualify, students must maintain a minimum 3.20 GPA and participate in at least half of their team's contests. The honorees include Mercedes Schroer, Taylor Hamlett, Morhéa Hoefen, Kylee Beinecke, Makenna Morrison, Dominique Popa, Sydney Thompson, and Kayla Perfect. This accolade highlights the commitment of these athletes to succeed in their academic pursuits while competing at a high level.
- Eight Miami University athletes recognized.
- All honorees maintain a minimum GPA of 3.48, with the highest being 3.96.
While the recognition celebrates individual achievements, it raises questions about the balance student-athletes must strike between their academic responsibilities and athletic commitments. Critics argue that the pressure to perform in both areas can lead to increased stress levels.
State of Play- The Academic All-MAC team selection reflects ongoing trends in collegiate athletics.
- Miami's focus on academic excellence continues to foster competitive student-athletes.
Moving forward, Miami University may enhance its support programs for student-athletes to help them manage their dual commitments more effectively. Continued recognition in future academic teams will depend on the sustained performance of these athletes both in the classroom and on the field.
Bottom LineThe achievements of these eight RedHawks underscore the importance of academic success among student-athletes, setting a benchmark for future competitors. Their recognition serves as an inspiration for a balanced approach to both athletics and academics.
Read more at Miami University RedHawks
